Crockpot Beef and Cabbage Soup

Ingredients:

  • 85% Lean Ground Beef: 1 Lb
  • Small Cabbage: 1 (1 1/2 Lb)
  • Small Yellow Onion, Diced: 1
  • Garlic, Minced: 4 Clove
  • Carrots, Peeled and Sliced: 4
  • 14.5oz Can Diced Tomatoes: 1
  • Bay Leaf: 3
  • Onion Powder: 1 Tsp
  • Pepper: 1 Tsp
  • Salt: 1 Tsp
  • Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking): 4 Cups
  • Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag: 1

    • Nutrition Data:

  • Servings: 6
  • Serving Size: 1-2/3 Cup
  • Calories: 250
  • Total Fat: 11g
  • Saturated Fat: 5g
  • Cholesterol: 50mg
  • Sodium: 1590mg
  • Carbohydrates: 21g
  • Fiber: 5g
  • Sugars: 6g
  • Protein: 17g
  • Vitamin A: 130%
  • Vitamin C: 120%
  • Calcium: 10%
  • Iron: 20%

    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: Label your freezer bag with the name of the recipe, cooking instructions, and 'use-by' date (3 months from when you prepped the meal).
    2: Add all ingredients to your freezer bag except broth.
    3: Remove as much air as possible, seal, and freeze for up to three months.
    4: Thaw freezer meal overnight in refrigerator or in morning in water.
    5: Add contents of freezer bag to crockpot with broth.
    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.
    7: Remove bay leaves and break apart ground beef.
    Add to List

Meat
  • 85% Lean Ground Beef x 1 Lb
  • Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast x 2 Lb
    • Produce
  • Small Cabbage x 1 (1 1/2 Lb)
  • Small Yellow Onion, Diced x 2
  • Garlic, Minced x 4 Clove
  • Carrots, Peeled and Sliced x 5
  • Russet Potatoes x 1 Lbs
    • Canned
  • 14.5oz Can Diced Tomatoes x 1
    • Spices
  • Bay Leaf x 3
  • Onion Powder x 1.25 Tsp
  • Pepper x 1.25 Tsp
  • Salt x 1 Tsp
  • Dried Minced Onion Flakes x 0.25 Cups
  • Parsley x 0.25 Teaspoon
  • Celery Seed x 0.25 Tsp
  • Paprika x 0.25 Tsp
    • Not Needed Until Day of Cooking
  • Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking) x 5 Cups
    • Materials
  • Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag x 2
    • Your Selected Meals:
    1: Crockpot Beef and Cabbage Soup
    Ingredients:
  • 1 x Lb 85% Lean Ground Beef
  • 1 x (1 1/2 Lb) Small Cabbage
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 4 x Clove Garlic, Minced
  • 4 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x 14.5oz Can Diced Tomatoes
  • 3 x Bay Leaf
  • 1 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 1 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Tsp Salt
  • 4 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: Label your freezer bag with the name of the recipe, cooking instructions, and 'use-by' date (3 months from when you prepped the meal).

    2: Add all ingredients to your freezer bag except broth.

    3: Remove as much air as possible, seal, and freeze for up to three months.

    4: Thaw freezer meal overnight in refrigerator or in morning in water.

    5: Add contents of freezer bag to crockpot with broth.

    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.

    7: Remove bay leaves and break apart ground beef.

    2: Crockpot Classic Pot Roast
    Ingredients:
  • 2 x Lb Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast
  • 1 x Lbs Russet Potatoes
  • 1 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 0.25 x Cups Dried Minced Onion Flakes
  • 0.25 x Teaspoon Parsley
  • 0.25 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 0.25 x Tsp Celery Seed
  • 0.25 x Tsp Paprika
  • 0.25 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: LABEL FREEZER BAG.

    2: ADD ALL INGREDIENTS TO YOUR FREEZER BAG (EXCEPT BEEF BROTH). TO KEEP POTATOES FROM BROWNING, CHOP THEM LAST AND ADD THEM TO THE TOP OF YOUR FREEZER BAG.

    3: REMOVE AS MUCH AIR FROM THE FREEZER BAG AS POSSIBLE, SEAL, AND LAY FLAT IN YOUR FREEZER.

    4: THE NIGHT BEFORE COOKING, MOVE FROZEN BAG TO YOUR REFRIGERATOR TO THAW.

    5: THE MORNING OF COOKING, POUR CONTENTS OF FREEZER BAG INTO YOUR SLOW COOKER AND ADD BEEF BROTH.

    6: COOK ON LOW SETTING FOR 8 HOURS OR UNTIL BEEF IS COOKED THROUGH AND TENDER.

    Stop and save!

    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.

    2: Crockpot Classic Pot Roast
    Ingredients:
  • 2 x Lb Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast
  • 1 x Lbs Russet Potatoes
  • 1 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 0.25 x Cups Dried Minced Onion Flakes
  • 0.25 x Teaspoon Parsley
  • 0.25 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 0.25 x Tsp Celery Seed
  • 0.25 x Tsp Paprika
  • 0.25 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: LABEL FREEZER BAG.

    3: REMOVE AS MUCH AIR FROM THE FREEZER BAG AS POSSIBLE, SEAL, AND LAY FLAT IN YOUR FREEZER.

    4: THE NIGHT BEFORE COOKING, MOVE FROZEN BAG TO YOUR REFRIGERATOR TO THAW.

    5: THE MORNING OF COOKING, POUR CONTENTS OF FREEZER BAG INTO YOUR SLOW COOKER AND ADD BEEF BROTH.

    6: COOK ON LOW SETTING FOR 8 HOURS OR UNTIL BEEF IS COOKED THROUGH AND TENDER.

    3: Remove as much air as possible, seal, and freeze for up to three months.

    4: Thaw freezer meal overnight in refrigerator or in morning in water.

    5: Add contents of freezer bag to crockpot with broth.

    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.

  • 1 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 1 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Tsp Salt
  • 4 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: Label your freezer bag with the name of the recipe, cooking instructions, and 'use-by' date (3 months from when you prepped the meal).

    2: Add all ingredients to your freezer bag except broth.

    3: Remove as much air as possible, seal, and freeze for up to three months.

    4: Thaw freezer meal overnight in refrigerator or in morning in water.

    5: Add contents of freezer bag to crockpot with broth.

    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.

    7: Remove bay leaves and break apart ground beef.

    2: Crockpot Classic Pot Roast
    Ingredients:
  • 2 x Lb Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast
  • 1 x Lbs Russet Potatoes
  • 1 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 0.25 x Cups Dried Minced Onion Flakes
  • 0.25 x Teaspoon Parsley
  • 0.25 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 0.25 x Tsp Celery Seed
  • 0.25 x Tsp Paprika
  • 0.25 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: LABEL FREEZER BAG.

    3: REMOVE AS MUCH AIR FROM THE FREEZER BAG AS POSSIBLE, SEAL, AND LAY FLAT IN YOUR FREEZER.

    4: THE NIGHT BEFORE COOKING, MOVE FROZEN BAG TO YOUR REFRIGERATOR TO THAW.

    5: THE MORNING OF COOKING, POUR CONTENTS OF FREEZER BAG INTO YOUR SLOW COOKER AND ADD BEEF BROTH.

    6: COOK ON LOW SETTING FOR 8 HOURS OR UNTIL BEEF IS COOKED THROUGH AND TENDER.

  • 1 x (1 1/2 Lb) Small Cabbage
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 4 x Clove Garlic, Minced
  • 4 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x 14.5oz Can Diced Tomatoes
  • 3 x Bay Leaf
  • 1 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 1 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Tsp Salt
  • 4 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: Label your freezer bag with the name of the recipe, cooking instructions, and 'use-by' date (3 months from when you prepped the meal).

    2: Add all ingredients to your freezer bag except broth.

    3: Remove as much air as possible, seal, and freeze for up to three months.

    4: Thaw freezer meal overnight in refrigerator or in morning in water.

    5: Add contents of freezer bag to crockpot with broth.

    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.

    7: Remove bay leaves and break apart ground beef.

    2: Crockpot Classic Pot Roast
    Ingredients:
  • 2 x Lb Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast
  • 1 x Lbs Russet Potatoes
  • 1 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 0.25 x Cups Dried Minced Onion Flakes
  • 0.25 x Teaspoon Parsley
  • 0.25 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 0.25 x Tsp Celery Seed
  • 0.25 x Tsp Paprika
  • 0.25 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: LABEL FREEZER BAG.

    2: ADD ALL INGREDIENTS TO YOUR FREEZER BAG (EXCEPT BEEF BROTH). TO KEEP POTATOES FROM BROWNING, CHOP THEM LAST AND ADD THEM TO THE TOP OF YOUR FREEZER BAG.

    3: REMOVE AS MUCH AIR FROM THE FREEZER BAG AS POSSIBLE, SEAL, AND LAY FLAT IN YOUR FREEZER.

    4: THE NIGHT BEFORE COOKING, MOVE FROZEN BAG TO YOUR REFRIGERATOR TO THAW.

    5: THE MORNING OF COOKING, POUR CONTENTS OF FREEZER BAG INTO YOUR SLOW COOKER AND ADD BEEF BROTH.

    6: COOK ON LOW SETTING FOR 8 HOURS OR UNTIL BEEF IS COOKED THROUGH AND TENDER.

    Stop and save!

  • 1 x Tsp Pepper

    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: Label your freezer bag with the name of the recipe, cooking instructions, and 'use-by' date (3 months from when you prepped the meal).

    2: Add all ingredients to your freezer bag except broth.

    3: Remove as much air as possible, seal, and freeze for up to three months.

    4: Thaw freezer meal overnight in refrigerator or in morning in water.

    5: Add contents of freezer bag to crockpot with broth.

    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.

    1: Crockpot Beef and Cabbage Soup
    Ingredients:
  • 1 x Lb 85% Lean Ground Beef
  • 1 x (1 1/2 Lb) Small Cabbage
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 4 x Clove Garlic, Minced
  • 4 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x 14.5oz Can Diced Tomatoes
  • 3 x Bay Leaf
  • 1 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 1 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Tsp Salt
  • 4 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: Label your freezer bag with the name of the recipe, cooking instructions, and 'use-by' date (3 months from when you prepped the meal).

    2: Add all ingredients to your freezer bag except broth.

    3: Remove as much air as possible, seal, and freeze for up to three months.

    4: Thaw freezer meal overnight in refrigerator or in morning in water.

    5: Add contents of freezer bag to crockpot with broth.

    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.

    7: Remove bay leaves and break apart ground beef.

    2: Crockpot Classic Pot Roast
    Ingredients:
  • 2 x Lb Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast
  • 1 x Lbs Russet Potatoes
  • 1 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 0.25 x Cups Dried Minced Onion Flakes
  • 0.25 x Teaspoon Parsley
  • 0.25 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 0.25 x Tsp Celery Seed
  • 0.25 x Tsp Paprika
  • 0.25 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: LABEL FREEZER BAG.

    2: ADD ALL INGREDIENTS TO YOUR FREEZER BAG (EXCEPT BEEF BROTH). TO KEEP POTATOES FROM BROWNING, CHOP THEM LAST AND ADD THEM TO THE TOP OF YOUR FREEZER BAG.

    3: REMOVE AS MUCH AIR FROM THE FREEZER BAG AS POSSIBLE, SEAL, AND LAY FLAT IN YOUR FREEZER.

    4: THE NIGHT BEFORE COOKING, MOVE FROZEN BAG TO YOUR REFRIGERATOR TO THAW.

    5: THE MORNING OF COOKING, POUR CONTENTS OF FREEZER BAG INTO YOUR SLOW COOKER AND ADD BEEF BROTH.

    6: COOK ON LOW SETTING FOR 8 HOURS OR UNTIL BEEF IS COOKED THROUGH AND TENDER.

    • Your Selected Meals:
    1: Crockpot Beef and Cabbage Soup
    Ingredients:
  • 1 x Lb 85% Lean Ground Beef
  • 1 x (1 1/2 Lb) Small Cabbage
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 4 x Clove Garlic, Minced
  • 4 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x 14.5oz Can Diced Tomatoes
  • 3 x Bay Leaf
  • 1 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 1 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Tsp Salt
  • 4 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: Label your freezer bag with the name of the recipe, cooking instructions, and 'use-by' date (3 months from when you prepped the meal).

    2: Add all ingredients to your freezer bag except broth.

    3: Remove as much air as possible, seal, and freeze for up to three months.

    4: Thaw freezer meal overnight in refrigerator or in morning in water.

    5: Add contents of freezer bag to crockpot with broth.

    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.

    7: Remove bay leaves and break apart ground beef.

    2: Crockpot Classic Pot Roast
    Ingredients:
  • 2 x Lb Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast
  • 1 x Lbs Russet Potatoes
  • 1 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 0.25 x Cups Dried Minced Onion Flakes
  • 0.25 x Teaspoon Parsley
  • 0.25 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 0.25 x Tsp Celery Seed
  • 0.25 x Tsp Paprika
  • 0.25 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: LABEL FREEZER BAG.

    2: ADD ALL INGREDIENTS TO YOUR FREEZER BAG (EXCEPT BEEF BROTH). TO KEEP POTATOES FROM BROWNING, CHOP THEM LAST AND ADD THEM TO THE TOP OF YOUR FREEZER BAG.

    3: REMOVE AS MUCH AIR FROM THE FREEZER BAG AS POSSIBLE, SEAL, AND LAY FLAT IN YOUR FREEZER.

    4: THE NIGHT BEFORE COOKING, MOVE FROZEN BAG TO YOUR REFRIGERATOR TO THAW.

    5: THE MORNING OF COOKING, POUR CONTENTS OF FREEZER BAG INTO YOUR SLOW COOKER AND ADD BEEF BROTH.

    6: COOK ON LOW SETTING FOR 8 HOURS OR UNTIL BEEF IS COOKED THROUGH AND TENDER.

    Stop and save!

  • 85% Lean Ground Beef x 1 Lb
  • Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast x 2 Lb
    • Produce
  • Small Cabbage x 1 (1 1/2 Lb)
  • Small Yellow Onion, Diced x 2
  • Garlic, Minced x 4 Clove
  • Carrots, Peeled and Sliced x 5
  • Russet Potatoes x 1 Lbs
    • Canned
  • 14.5oz Can Diced Tomatoes x 1
    • Spices
  • Bay Leaf x 3
  • Onion Powder x 1.25 Tsp
  • Pepper x 1.25 Tsp
  • Salt x 1 Tsp
  • Dried Minced Onion Flakes x 0.25 Cups
  • Parsley x 0.25 Teaspoon
  • Celery Seed x 0.25 Tsp
  • Paprika x 0.25 Tsp
    • Not Needed Until Day of Cooking
  • Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking) x 5 Cups
    • Materials
  • Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag x 2
    • Your Selected Meals:
    1: Crockpot Beef and Cabbage Soup
    Ingredients:
  • 1 x Lb 85% Lean Ground Beef
  • 1 x (1 1/2 Lb) Small Cabbage
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 4 x Clove Garlic, Minced
  • 4 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x 14.5oz Can Diced Tomatoes
  • 3 x Bay Leaf
  • 1 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 1 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Tsp Salt
  • 4 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: Label your freezer bag with the name of the recipe, cooking instructions, and 'use-by' date (3 months from when you prepped the meal).

    2: Add all ingredients to your freezer bag except broth.

    3: Remove as much air as possible, seal, and freeze for up to three months.

    4: Thaw freezer meal overnight in refrigerator or in morning in water.

    5: Add contents of freezer bag to crockpot with broth.

    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.

    7: Remove bay leaves and break apart ground beef.

    2: Crockpot Classic Pot Roast
    Ingredients:
  • 2 x Lb Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast
  • 1 x Lbs Russet Potatoes
  • 1 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 0.25 x Cups Dried Minced Onion Flakes
  • 0.25 x Teaspoon Parsley
  • 0.25 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 0.25 x Tsp Celery Seed
  • 0.25 x Tsp Paprika
  • 0.25 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: LABEL FREEZER BAG.

    2: ADD ALL INGREDIENTS TO YOUR FREEZER BAG (EXCEPT BEEF BROTH). TO KEEP POTATOES FROM BROWNING, CHOP THEM LAST AND ADD THEM TO THE TOP OF YOUR FREEZER BAG.

    3: REMOVE AS MUCH AIR FROM THE FREEZER BAG AS POSSIBLE, SEAL, AND LAY FLAT IN YOUR FREEZER.

    4: THE NIGHT BEFORE COOKING, MOVE FROZEN BAG TO YOUR REFRIGERATOR TO THAW.

    5: THE MORNING OF COOKING, POUR CONTENTS OF FREEZER BAG INTO YOUR SLOW COOKER AND ADD BEEF BROTH.

    6: COOK ON LOW SETTING FOR 8 HOURS OR UNTIL BEEF IS COOKED THROUGH AND TENDER.

    Stop and save!

Meat
  • 85% Lean Ground Beef x 1 Lb
  • Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast x 2 Lb
    • Produce
  • Small Cabbage x 1 (1 1/2 Lb)
  • Small Yellow Onion, Diced x 2
  • Garlic, Minced x 4 Clove
  • Carrots, Peeled and Sliced x 5
  • Russet Potatoes x 1 Lbs
    • Canned
  • 14.5oz Can Diced Tomatoes x 1
    • Spices
  • Bay Leaf x 3
  • Onion Powder x 1.25 Tsp
  • Pepper x 1.25 Tsp
  • Salt x 1 Tsp
  • Dried Minced Onion Flakes x 0.25 Cups
  • Parsley x 0.25 Teaspoon
  • Celery Seed x 0.25 Tsp
  • Paprika x 0.25 Tsp
    • Not Needed Until Day of Cooking
  • Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking) x 5 Cups
    • Materials
  • Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag x 2
    • Your Selected Meals:
    1: Crockpot Beef and Cabbage Soup
    Ingredients:
  • 1 x Lb 85% Lean Ground Beef
  • 1 x (1 1/2 Lb) Small Cabbage
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 4 x Clove Garlic, Minced
  • 4 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x 14.5oz Can Diced Tomatoes
  • 3 x Bay Leaf
  • 1 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 1 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Tsp Salt
  • 4 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: Label your freezer bag with the name of the recipe, cooking instructions, and 'use-by' date (3 months from when you prepped the meal).

    2: Add all ingredients to your freezer bag except broth.

    3: Remove as much air as possible, seal, and freeze for up to three months.

    4: Thaw freezer meal overnight in refrigerator or in morning in water.

    5: Add contents of freezer bag to crockpot with broth.

    6: Cook on low setting for 6 hours in a 6-quart crockpot or 8-10 hours in a 4-quart crockpot.

    7: Remove bay leaves and break apart ground beef.

    2: Crockpot Classic Pot Roast
    Ingredients:
  • 2 x Lb Boneless Beef Chuck Shoulder Roast
  • 1 x Lbs Russet Potatoes
  • 1 x Carrots, Peeled and Sliced
  • 1 x Small Yellow Onion, Diced
  • 0.25 x Cups Dried Minced Onion Flakes
  • 0.25 x Teaspoon Parsley
  • 0.25 x Tsp Onion Powder
  • 0.25 x Tsp Celery Seed
  • 0.25 x Tsp Paprika
  • 0.25 x Tsp Pepper
  • 1 x Cups Beef Broth (not needed until day of cooking)
  • 1 x Gallon-Sized Plastic Freezer Bag
    • Cooking Instructions:

    1: LABEL FREEZER BAG.

    2: ADD ALL INGREDIENTS TO YOUR FREEZER BAG (EXCEPT BEEF BROTH). TO KEEP POTATOES FROM BROWNING, CHOP THEM LAST AND ADD THEM TO THE TOP OF YOUR FREEZER BAG.

    3: REMOVE AS MUCH AIR FROM THE FREEZER BAG AS POSSIBLE, SEAL, AND LAY FLAT IN YOUR FREEZER.

    4: THE NIGHT BEFORE COOKING, MOVE FROZEN BAG TO YOUR REFRIGERATOR TO THAW.

    5: THE MORNING OF COOKING, POUR CONTENTS OF FREEZER BAG INTO YOUR SLOW COOKER AND ADD BEEF BROTH.

    6: COOK ON LOW SETTING FOR 8 HOURS OR UNTIL BEEF IS COOKED THROUGH AND TENDER.

    Stop and save!

  • 0.25 x Tsp Paprika
